title.value: FoMo-Bench: a multi-modal, multi-scale and multi-task Forest Monitoring Benchmark for remote sensing foundation models
title.justification: This title accurately reflects the content and contributions of the paper, specifically focusing on the proposed benchmark, dataset, and model.
title.quote: FoMo-Bench: a multi-modal, multi-scale and multi-task Forest Monitoring Benchmark for remote sensing foundation models

extractions.description: This paper introduces FoMo-Bench, the first comprehensive benchmark for forest monitoring, integrating multiple remote sensing datasets and modalities. It also proposes the novel dataset TalloS for tree species classification and the foundation model FoMo-Net designed for multi-modal and multi-task remote sensing applications.

type.justification: The paper presents real-world datasets and experimental results to evaluate the proposed benchmark and model, which characterizes it as an empirical study.
type.quote: To further enhance the diversity of tasks and geographies represented in FoMo-Bench, we introduce a novel global dataset, TalloS, combining satellite imagery with ground-based annotations for tree species classification... Finally, we propose FoMo-Net, a baseline foundation model with the capacity to process any combination of commonly used spectral bands in remote sensing, across diverse ground sampling distances and geographical locations worldwide.

name.justification: The paper is rooted in the domain of remote sensing and forest monitoring, which are subfields of computer vision.
name.quote: ...inspired by the rise of foundation models for computer vision and remote sensing, we here present the first unified Forest Monitoring Benchmark (FoMo-Bench).

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with remote sensing data modalities such as satellite imagery, SAR, and LiDAR, focusing on forest monitoring.
name.quote: ...inspired by the rise of foundation models for computer vision and remote sensing, we here present the first unified Forest Monitoring Benchmark (FoMo-Bench).

name.justification: The paper introduces FoMo-Net as a baseline foundation model for forest monitoring using remote sensing.
name.quote: Finally, we propose FoMo-Net, a baseline foundation model with the capacity to process any combination of commonly used spectral bands in remote sensing, across diverse ground sampling distances and geographical locations worldwide.

name.justification: The TalloS dataset is introduced in this paper to enhance the diversity of tasks and geographies represented in FoMo-Bench, focusing on tree species classification using multi-modal remote sensing data.
name.quote: To further enhance the diversity of tasks and geographies represented in FoMo-Bench, we introduce a novel global dataset, TalloS, combining satellite imagery with ground-based annotations for tree species classification...

name.justification: The NeonTree dataset is included in the FoMo-Bench benchmark for tree crown detection using high-resolution RGB, LiDAR, and hyperspectral data.
name.quote: The NeonTree dataset focuses on tree crown detection with RGB imagery, LiDAR and hyperspectral data recorded from airborne systems.

name.justification: The Woody dataset is used in the FoMo-Bench benchmark for the detection of several invasive tree species in Chile using UAV imagery.
name.quote: The Woody dataset is composed of RGB images recorded from an UAV, at several cm resolution, for detection of several invasive tree species in Chile.

name.justification: ReforesTree is part of the FoMo-Bench benchmark, combining UAV data with ground measurements to detect trees and estimate aboveground biomass.
name.quote: Similarly, the ReforesTree dataset is designed for tree crown detection with 6 classes using high-resolution RGB images recorded from an UAV, as well as ground measurements, such as tree height and diameter at breast height.

name.justification: The Spekboom dataset is included in the FoMo-Bench benchmark and is used for mapping tree species in South Africa using UAV imagery.
name.quote: Similarly, the Spekboom dataset is composed of RGB images recorded from UAVs to map tree species in South Africa and New Zealand, respectively.

name.justification: The FLAIR #1 dataset is included in the FoMo-Bench benchmark for spatiotemporal LULC classification with high-resolution aerial imagery.
name.quote: Unlike the previous aerial datasets, FLAIR #1 and FLAIR #2 are large-scale datasets testing spatiotemporal generalization.

name.justification: The FLAIR #2 dataset is part of the FoMo-Bench benchmark for spatiotemporal LULC classification with Sentinel-2 timeseries and high-resolution aerial imagery.

name.justification: The FORinstance dataset is part of the FoMo-Bench benchmark for tree segmentation, providing LiDAR point clouds and semantic annotations.
name.quote: The FORinstance dataset provides a unique source of data with LiDAR point clouds and semantic annotations collected in 5 countries.
